result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P Holub was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Steven P Holub was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven P Holub is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Steven P Holub was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

AMENDED 06-02-2015 BY THE COURT. DEFENDANT IS DUE 186 DAYS CFTS

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant is not to possess any firearms and is to turn in his CCW license.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Anger Management. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

State moves for judgment on verdict as to Ct. 2 and judgment notwithstanding the verdict on Ct. 1.
Defense moves for judgment on verdict as to Ct. 1 and judgment notwithstanding the verdict on Ct. 2.
BTC:  Both motions are denied.  Acquital is granted as to Ct. 1 and conviction is granted as to Ct. 2.

Defendant Steven P Holub in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Defendant Steven P Holub in custody.  Robert S Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.  Transcript filed: 06-09-2015 vw. There is no offer to consider.  Parties are prepared for trial.  Charges read from the  Information including weapons enhancer for parties to agree.  Parties agree.
Jury enters the courtroom and is sworn by the clerk.  23 jurors are seated.  13 jurors will be chosen.

Attorney Severino is sole practioner.

Jury excused at 3:17 pm
  Jury trial scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Jury trial on June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven P Holub in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Defendant Steven P Holub in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 06-03-2015/tk
Ms. Severino indicates she requested a new speedy trial back in January as she was just appointed in December. The State relies on the Court's minutes but he does have subpoena's out for 3/18.
Upon review of the transcript, the Court indicates that the trial is not designated as a speedy trial. Ms. Severino indicates that when the date was set, she believes that she requested this trial be designated as a speedy trial.

Defense will ask for a self defense instruction in this matter. Ms. Severino indicates that this matter may fall under the Castle Doctrine and there is come debate as to what kind of instruction should be given. Defense will prepare additional proposed JI that would address the issues.

BTC: The Court indicates this trial is not set as a speedy trial for next week and another trial is set to go. This matter is 2nd on the JT list. The State may use the term "alleged victim".  The Court does not accept speedy trial demands orally, they must be in writing.  Jury trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven P Holub in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Steven P Holub in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 06-03-2015/tk
The Court has received a handwritten document from Atty Gamez. Defense indicates the family can post $1000.00 cash and asks the Court for co-signature bond or signature bond for the balance. Defendant does not oppose GPS with exceptions only for significant medical issues, court hearings and meetings with attorney. The State objects to bond modification as requested due to the allegations in the complaint and the deft's previous contacts with the criminal justice system. The State asks that bond remain as set.

BTC: bond modification is denied
